snippet: The arrest of the executive, Diego Dzodan, comes as a debate over the access that law enforcement officials should get to tech companies’ data has escalated.
abstract: Federal police in Brazil arrest Facebook vice president Diego Dzodan after company failed to comply with judge's order to turn over information from WhatsApp messaging account linked to drug trafficking investigation.

byline.original: By VINOD SREEHARSHA and MIKE ISAAC
byline.contributor: Vinod Sreeharsha reported from Rio de Janeiro and Mike Isaac from New York.

lead_paragraph: The arrest of the executive, Diego Dzodan, comes as a debate over the access that law enforcement officials should get to tech companies’ data has escalated.

headline.main: Brazil Arrests Facebook Executive in WhatsApp Data Access Case
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Police Arrest a Facebook Executive in a WhatsApp Data Access Case
